articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Participates in Swearing in Ceremony of South African President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Participates in Swearing in Ceremony of South African President
Pyongyang, May 10 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, took part in the swearing in ceremony of the South African President held at the presidential palace on May 9.
					 Attending the ceremony were heads of state and government of different countries, foreign guests and personages of all social standings in South Africa.
					
					Jacob Gedleyihlekisa Zuma, President of South Africa, made an inaugural address there.
					
					 A reception was given in celebration of the presidential inauguration that day.

articles.title: Talks between FMs of DPRK and Peru Held
articles.content:
Talks between FMs of DPRK and Peru Held
 Pyongyang, May 10 (KCNA) -- Talks were held in Lima on May 7 between Pak Ui Chun, foreign minister of the DPRK who is heading the government delegation on a visit to Peru, and Jose Garcia Belaunde, foreign minister of Peru.
					 Present there from the DPRK side were members of the delegation and the DPRK ambassador to Peru and from the opposite side were a vice-minister of Foreign Affairs and other officials concerned.
					
					 At the talks both sides discussed the matter of further developing the friendly relations between the two countries and exchanged views on issues of common concern.
					
					 The talks proceeded in a friendly atmosphere.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Il from Chinese Delegation
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il from Chinese Delegation
 Pyongyang, May 10 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il was presented with a gift by the delegation of the China-Korea Friendship Association on a visit to the DPRK to participate in a meeting of the Korea-China friendship city.
					 The gift was conveyed to an official concerned by Chairman of the association Wu Donghe who is leading the delegation.

articles.title: Wreaths Laid before Friendship Tower
articles.content:
Wreaths Laid before Friendship Tower
 Pyongyang, May 10 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the China-Korea Friendship Association led by Chairman Wu Donghe, a local government delegation of China headed by Vice-Chairman of the Sichuan Provincial People's Association for Friendship with Foreign Countries Wang Xian which groups people's government delegates from the provinces of Jiangxi, Shandong and Sichuan and the cities of Shanghai, Jilin, Hunchun, Tianjin and Changchun and a Jilin provincial people's government delegation of China headed by Vice-Governor Chen Weigen staying in the DPRK laid wreaths before the Friendship Tower on Sunday.
					 Present there were officials concerned and staff members of the Chinese embassy here.
					
					 The participants observed a moment's silence in memory of the martyrs of the Chinese People's Volunteers who valiantly fought after participating in the Korean front. And they went round the tower.

articles.title: DPRK Wrestlers Prove Successful in Asian Championships
articles.content:
DPRK Wrestlers Prove Successful in Asian Championships
 Pyongyang, May 10 (KCNA) -- Wrestlers of the DPRK gave a good account of themselves in the 2009 Asian Wrestling Championships.
					 The championships brought together more than 250 men and women wrestlers from 25 countries and regions in Asia.
					
					 The DPRK bagged one gold, two silver and four bronze medals there.
					
					 Jo Tong Hyok placed first in the freestyle 60kg class and Yang Kyong Il and Han Kum Ok second each in men's freestyle 55kg class and in women's 51kg class.
					
					 Yang Chun Song came third in the freestyle 66kg class, Kim Won Mo and Kim Kum Chol each in greco-roman 55kg and 66kg classes and Choe Jong Bok in the women's 55kg class.

articles.title: Lee Myung Bak Group's Frantic Confrontation Moves Flayed
articles.content:
Lee Myung Bak Group's Frantic Confrontation Moves Flayed
 Pyongyang, May 10 (KCNA) -- No sooner had the DPRK declared an additional strong step for bolstering up its nuclear deterrent for self-defence than the Lee Myung Bak group of south Korea was busy taking "countermeasures", claiming that it is a "challenge to the international community" and the DPRK should "stop an act of threatening global peace" while letting the "Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade" slander it.
					 Rodong Sinmun in a signed commentary Sunday denounces this as another disgusting treachery of quislings who place foreign forces before the nation and act as their dirty stooges while getting hell-bent on confrontation with fellow countrymen.
					
					 The additional step taken by the DPRK is quite legitimate as this was prompted by its patriotic decision to shatter the evermore undisguised aggression moves of the hostile forces and defend the supreme interests of the country and the nation, the commentary says, and goes on:
					
					 In actuality, it is the Lee Myung Bak group that is challenging the international community's cause of peace and bringing dark clouds of war to not only the Korean Peninsula but also the rest of Northeast Asia.
					
					 The danger of a nuclear war growing in the Korean Peninsula is mainly attributable to the foolish policy of dependence on foreign forces and confrontation with fellow countrymen pursued by the Lee "government" which is blindly chiming with the foreign forces' war scheme for aggression on the DPRK. "International community" mentioned by the Lee group is none other than the U.S. and Japanese reactionaries. Nobody can deny the fact that the U.S. and Japanese reactionaries have pursued the policy of stifling the DPRK while extremely antagonizing it and sought to realize their ambition for invasion of the DPRK even by imposing disasters of a nuclear war upon the Korean nation.
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK regard the national dignity and sovereignty as their life and soul. So, steadfast is their stand to mercilessly punish the aggressors and quislings pouncing to encroach upon the said dignity and sovereignty.
					
					 The Lee group had better stop acting rashly, clearly understanding the revolutionary disposition of the army and people of the DPRK who do not make empty talk.

articles.title: Rejection of U.S. Protectionism Urged
articles.content:
Rejection of U.S. Protectionism Urged
Pyongyang, May 10 (KCNA) -- It is an urgent demand of the era at present to reject the U.S. protective trade policy and establish a new fair international economic order, Rodong Sinmun today says in a signed article.
					 Though it is a prime mover of the worldwide financial crisis, the United States persists in the unfair protectionist policy only to attain its selfish aims, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 Proceeding from its selfish purposes, the U.S. is pursuing the protectionist policy in disregard of the demand of international laws and international economic relations and thus giving negative influence to the economic development of other countries and hindering the world economic development and creating complexity.
					
					 Protectionism of the U.S. is one of the methods to dominate and plunder other countries in the new century.
					
					 It is a unilateral and crafty predatory policy as it is designed to seek only the interests of the U.S. in trade dealing with other countries, disregarding their interests.
					
					 The first victim of this policy is developing countries.
					
					 The U.S. is exporting its surplus goods to them en masse by ceaselessly putting pressure to open their markets. But it is building high-tariff and non-tariff barriers against those countries' exports to it in a bid to restrain the advance of developing countries into its domestic markets and gain its own interests.
					
					 The reality clearly proves that the said policy is a tool of domination and plunder to rake up its own profits in reward of sacrificing others and a wrong trade economic policy to hinder the world economic trade development and put it into confusion.
					
					 The international movement opposing the policy is surfacing this year, the article notes, urging the U.S. to retract its unilateral and selfish policy.

articles.title: Anti-reunification Fascist Crackdown Protested in S. Korea
articles.content:
Anti-reunification Fascist Crackdown Protested in S. Korea
Pyongyang, May 10 (KCNA) -- The Solidarity for Implementing the South-North Joint Declaration in south Korea issued a statement on May 7 to lash out at the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors' fascist crackdown upon the South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification (Pomminryon).
					 The statement noted that on the same day the "Intelligence Service" and the police staged a large-scale operation of seizure and search into the said headquarters and arrested its chairman and other leading members on charges of the violation of the "National Security Law."
					
					 The Lee Myung Bak "government" and the security authorities committed such fascist violence, branding its patriotic activities as "anti-state organization's activities of several years," it pointed out.
					
					 It said that the suppression is a revelation of their insidious intention to whip up the "new terror-ridden atmosphere" in a bid to prevent the all-people struggle for punishment of Lee Myung Bak growing stronger as the days go by.
					
					 The Lee Myung Bak "government" should be clearly mindful that such anachronistic frantic moves will only precipitate the stern punishment by the entire nation and all the south Korean people, the statement warned.
					
					 It declared that the solidarity bitterly condemns the above-said suppression and will more valiantly conduct the all-people struggle for defending and implementing the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration in unison with all other pro-reunification patriotic forces.
					
					 Meanwhile, the Kwangju and South Jolla Provincial Federation of Pomminryon and other civic and public organizations in Kwangju and South Jolla Province called a press conference on the same day to denounce the suppression as an anti-reunification deed of throwing a wet blanket over the reunification movement and an open fascist violence intended to check the people's resistance against the dictatorial "government" by dint of the "National Security Law", an outdated evil law.

articles.title: Lee Myung Bak Group's Repressive Actions Blasted in S. Korea
articles.content:
Lee Myung Bak Group's Repressive Actions Blasted in S. Korea
Pyongyang, May 10 (KCNA) -- Representatives of civic and public organizations in south Korea, including the Confederation of Trade Unions, the Citizens' Federation for Democratic Society and the Solidarity of Veterinaries for People's Health, held a meeting in Seoul on May 6 to denounce the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors for its evermore intensified crackdown upon the people.
					 At the meeting speakers noted that the demand of the people has not yet been met though one year passed since the candlelight actions staged across south Korea in protest against the American beef import.
					
					 They said it is unprecedented that the authorities blared that they would take a legal action against all of hundreds of people who were walked away after participating in the anti-"government" struggle waged on May Day and on the lapse of 100 days of the tragic death of evacuees in Ryongsan and one year of the candlelight actions.
					
					 The Lee "government's" fascist repression is retrogressing freedom and democracy, they deplored.
					
					 They demanded that the authorities punish all those involved in such suppression and set free the arrested citizens at once.
					
					 The "government" and the ruling party will face stronger resistance if they continue cracking down on the people, not drawing a lesson from the defeat they suffered at the "by-election of national assemblymen," they warned.
					
					 Then followed a press conference. In a press release those organizations stressed that they would vigorously stage the ceaseless candlelight action defying the deception and repression by the Lee Myung Bak "government" and thus bring about a new world where the people become its master.

articles.title: Suppression of Progressive Parties and Organizations in S. Korea under Fire
articles.content:
Suppression of Progressive Parties and Organizations in S. Korea under Fire
Pyongyang, May 10 (KCNA) -- On May 7 the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors in south Korea mobilized the puppet Intelligence Service and the police to make a surprise search of the house of the chairman for policy-making of the Kangwon Provincial Committee of the Democratic Labor Party and confiscate a computer and publications, etc. It also conducted a simultaneous operation of search into the offices of the South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification (Pomminryon) and its regional headquarters, the North Chungchong Provincial Federation of the south Korean Federation of Peasants Associations, the North Chungchong Provincial Headquarters of the South Side Committee for Implementing June 15 Joint Declaration, the Council of Youth Organizations in south Korean Kangwon Province, etc. and the houses of their leading members and committed such fascist violence as arresting and detaining the core members of those organizations.
					 In this regard a spokesman for the Central Committee of the Korean Social Democratic Party released a statement on Saturday.
					
					 The said repressive campaign, reminiscent of a military operation, is a deliberate wholesale strangling operation to totally eliminate the pro-reunification democratic forces in south Korea by groundlessly linking them with the DPRK, the statement said, denouncing it as a blatant challenge to the aspiration and desire of the south Korean people for new politics, which calls for respecting the will and interests of the working masses, and the independent reunification of the nation as well as intolerable provocation to the DPRK.
					
					 It further said:
					
					 The conservative ruling forces cracked down  without reason even upon the DLP, a legal progressive political party representing the will of the workers, peasants and other working popular masses. This is a hair-raising atrocity of the rough political gangsters to brutally trample down upon the activities of the party after labeling them as "illegal".
					
					 The Lee group is sadly mistaken if it thinks it can deceive the public and build up an opinion that the present political and economic crisis going from bad to worse in south Korea and the towering resistance and wrath of the people from all walks of life toward the conservative ruling forces are caused by the pro-reunification patriotic forces.
					
					 The flames of the anti-"government" struggle raging across south Korea are an inevitable result of traitor Lee Myung Bak's wicked unpopular rule.
					
					 The south Korean people have already sentenced the group of traitors to death.
					
					 Traitor Lee should be well aware of what miserable end the groups of traitors in the past met after strangling democracy and checking the independent reunification in south Korea.

articles.title: 8th Meeting of Board of Directors of African Regional Committee for Study of Juche Idea Held
articles.content:
8th Meeting of Board of Directors of African Regional Committee for Study of Juche Idea Held
 Pyongyang, May 10 (KCNA) -- The 8th meeting of the Board of Directors of the African Regional Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea took place in Democratic Congo on May 1.
					 It was attended by the members of the Board of Directors and delegates of Juche idea study organizations from Egypt, Ethiopia, Guinea, Nigeria, Uganda, Tanzania, South Africa, Democratic Congo and other countries in Africa.
					
					 A delegation of the International Institute of the Juche Idea and a delegation of the Social Scientists Society of Korea were present there on invitation.
					
					 The meeting reviewed the work done by the Board of Directors after its 7th meeting. And it discussed the tasks to be carried out by the Juche idea study organizations of different countries on the occasion of the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung and the matters arising in further improving the activities for study and dissemination of the Juche idea.

articles.title: African Regional Seminar on Juche Idea Held
articles.content:
African Regional Seminar on Juche Idea Held
Pyongyang, May 10 (KCNA) -- An African regional Juche idea seminar on the "Juche Idea and Prosperity of Africa" took place in Democratic Congo on May 1.
					 Baguma Isoke, director general of the African Regional Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, made a report at the seminar. Then followed speeches of Eddie Kekana, chairman  of the Group for the Study of the Progressive Ideas of South Africa, Riyad Chaloub, chairman of the Guinean National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, M. M. Alhassan, chairman of the Nigerian National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, Aba Sadik Abubakr, chairman of the Nigerian Group for the Study of the Juche Philosophy, Yehia Zakaria Khairullah, chairman of the Egyptian Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, Francis F. Lyimo, chairman of the Tanzanian National Coordinating Committee of the Juche Idea Study Groups, and other personages.
					
					 The reporter and speakers said the African adherents to the Juche idea are sure that the Juche idea should be regarded as their guideline in order to achieve the second liberation of Africa.
					
					 Noting that the Juche idea serves as a great banner of struggle brightly showing the road of carving out the destiny of each country and nation and achieving the independent development on a worldwide scale, they said with high appreciation that it is the feat of world-historic significance to be recorded in human history that President Kim Il Sung founded the man-centered Juche idea.
					
					Stressing that the Songun politics of the DPRK is a great political mode helping each country and nation reject the imperialists' policy of strength and neo-colonialism and defend and hew out their destiny, they highly praised General Secretary Kim Jong Il as the peerless statesman possessed of extraordinary wisdom and courage.
					
					 An appeal to the Juche idea study organizations and adherents the world over was adopted at the seminar.
					
					 The appeal underscored the need to intensify the study and dissemination of the Juche idea and thus make 2012, the centenary of the birth of Kim Il Sung, an occasion of new turning phase in accelerating the cause of global independence.
					
					 A letter to Kim Jong Il was adopted at the seminar. 
					
					 The letter noted that at the seminar all the African countries recognized once again that they are now faced with dominationism and neo-colonialism and reached an identity of view that the banner of the Juche idea should be held higher to solve this problem.
					
					 It said that the participants in the seminar are full of determination to invigorate the study and dissemination of the Juche idea on the occasion of the centenary of the birth of the President and thus positively contribute to building free and prosperous Africa.

articles.title: DPRK's Self-defensive Measure Hailed
articles.content:
DPRK's Self-defensive Measure Hailed
 Pyongyang, May 10 (KCNA) -- The Switzerland-Korea Committee issued a statement on May 3 in support of the April 29 statement of a spokesman for the DPRK Foreign Ministry.
					 The statement recalled that the Foreign Ministry spokesman declared the DPRK's principled stand as regards the illegal provocation the UNSC committed by setting in motion the sanctions against the DPRK over its satellite launch for peaceful purposes.
					
					 The committee regards the DPRK's warnings as a legitimate step for its self-defence, the statement said.
					
					 It stressed that the DPRK will never allow to be disarmed and that the DPRK wants peace but will not beg for it.
